definitions.body: congregation (prop. company assembled together by appointment, or acting concertedly)—´[[ע]] Nu 16:2 + 85 t.; cstr. [[עֲדַת]] Ex 12:3 + 52 t.; sf. [[עֲדָתִי]] Job 16:7 + 9 t. sfs.;—

[[עֲדַת־אֵל]] Ps 82:1 congregation of Ēl, of company of angels (‖[[בקרב אלהים ]]); [[לְאֻמִּים]] ´[[ע]] Ps 7:8 congregation of peoples; [[חַדִּיקִים]] ´[[ע]] Ps 1:5 congregation of the righteous; ‖[[סוֹד יְשָׁרִים]] Ps 111:1; ‖[[קהל]] Pr 5:14; [[כָּל־עֲדָתִי]] Job 16:7 (of Job's circle of dependents); in a bad sense, [[מְרֵעִים]] ´[[ע]] company of evil doers Ps 22:17; [[עריחים]] ´[[ע]] Ps 86:14; [[חנף]] ´[[ע]] Job 15:34; [[קׂרַח]] ´[[ע]] company of Korah Nu 26:9, Nu 27:3 (P), so [[עֲדָתוֹ]], [[עֲדָֽתְְ]] Nu 16:5, Nu 16:6, Nu 16:11, Nu 16:16, Nu 17:5 (P), and [[הָעֵדָה]] Nu 26:10, Nu 27:3 (P); [[אֲבִירָם]] ´[[ע]] Ps 106:17, cf. v:Ps 106:18.
of animals ´[[ע]] [[אַבִּירִים]] Ps 68:31 (fig. of nobles); [[דְּבׂרִים]] ´[[ע]] Ju Jdg 14:8 a swarm of bees.
